instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.P3V3S5_EN: What is P3V3S5_EN? P3V3S5_EN is a signal that enables the power chip responsible for creating PP3V3_S5 when it is high. Signals with _EN mean that whatever is mentioned before the _EN will be enabled or turned on when the signal is high. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S5L: What is PM_SLP_S5L? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S5_L When you see PM_SLP_S5L, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S5_L.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: 2012 MBP <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on
threads.message:
Hello. I have a 2012 Retina MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that fails to power on.
There is a green light on the charger (turns to amber)
All voltages are present except for <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>.
<SIGNAL>P3V3S5_EN</SIGNAL> is Present
No <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5L</SIGNAL>
No <SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL>

There are no shorts to ground on any lines on <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> or <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>
Bad <CHIP>U4900</CHIP>? Bad CPU?

Any help is appreciated

threads.title: 2012 MBP <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turning on
threads.message:
Test the board alone on the desk.
Post diode mode at <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>.
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?
